lines.text: Are you freaking-out? Last year we had a student freak-out on us.
You are freaking-out now, aren't you?
No.
We had a student freak-out three years ago.

Now I know that in some of your universities the students say, oh no - we don't want literature, not philosophy for us this year. This year we think we will study... mushrooms. Mushrooms? I have news for you. This year, at my school, you will not study mushrooms!
You know, I don't understand anything you are saying.
Don't you speak French?
Not your French.
Speak English, Albert. You need the practice.
Oh certainly my dear.
[mockingly]
Yeah, right on, groovy, far out, I go with the flow.
Do you like the house? We decorated these rooms in what we call the Eisenhower 50's style. It's very hard to find good American furniture from that period in Paris.
You know, you could have told me you'd been here before.
I didn't even think about Stephen until they mentioned it.
Mentioned it. They had a goddamn billboard with your picture on it.
Maybe I should drive.
In my country, women do not drive.
Figures.
In my country, in fact, the women run behind the cars.

[recalling his trip]
I spent a week in Grenada mostly watching the famous rain in Spain. All in all the trip was incredibly - it was - lonely. But don't tell Joel that, ok. I just told him the trip was great.
Yeah, I was going to say that about my trip. But it's hard when they bring you back in an ambulance.
Come back with me to the States. Your English is good. You're studying to be a teacher. I've taught you all the best dirty words. You can tutor French and live with me.
I've had enough experience - plenty. Right now I'm just going to travel a little this summer and then I'm going back to Ohio. It's quiet there. I can recuperate from all my experience.
Joel, are you doing a chicken-out on me?
